axioms.name: Formal Medium Primacy
axioms.statement: Comics' unique power emerges from the structural interplay of verbal and visual elements; formal experimentation unlocks latent possibilities.
derivations: Comics has possibilities that people have not even begun to touch
Moore is one of the first writers to apply literary and formalist sensibilities to the mainstream of the medium
Watchmen's grid creates meaning through structural constraint

axioms.name: Density and Re-readability
axioms.statement: Density creates re-readability and rewards engaged readers; however, density must serve the story's idea rather than demonstrate authorial cleverness.
derivations: Moore's scripts are legendarily dense (1,032 pages for 12 issues)
Watchmen and V for Vendetta rank among the densest graphic narratives
League of Extraordinary Gentlemen caters to readers with obscure allusions

axioms.name: Grid as Musical Score
axioms.statement: The grid establishes rhythmic baseline; deviations from grid create emphasis (dynamics).
derivations: Reading comics involves beats, sighs, pauses and measures - a natural rhythm
The 9-panel grid is the iambic pentameter of comics
High rhythm and high tempo are not virtues in themselves - pacing is about change
A nine-panel grid is very high rhythm - use it for tense sequences

axioms.name: Mastery Before Deconstruction
axioms.statement: Effective deconstruction requires prior demonstration of genre mastery; Moore's deconstructive power derives from working within genre conventions.
derivations: Moore's career arc: Marvelman to Swamp Thing to Watchmen
Moore practically made a career out of Genre Deconstruction, particularly with superheroes
Watchmen deconstructs the superhero genre, examining its conventions and tropes to critique and subvert them

axioms.name: Idea Precedes Plot
axioms.statement: The idea is what the story is about; not the plot of the story, or the unfolding of events within that story, but what the story is essentially about.
derivations: Story generation should begin with thematic core (IDEA) before event sequencing (PLOT)
The idea functions as a constraint that filters all subsequent decisions

axioms.name: The Discomfort Principle
axioms.statement: When a writer becomes comfortable, it erodes creativity. It therefore behooves the writer to become uncomfortable, change genre, technique, or style, sometimes all three.
derivations: Generative systems should include constraint-randomization or forced-variation mechanisms
Prevents formulaic output through deliberate disruption

axioms.name: Invisible Transitions
axioms.statement: When you do a sucky job writing your story, people are aware they're reading a story, and that defeats the point. A lot of us blow it in the transitions.
derivations: The goal is reader-invisible structural mechanics

levels.name: Idea (Thematic Core)
levels.description: What the story is essentially about - the foundational constraint that filters all decisions

levels.name: Structure (Formal Architecture)
levels.description: The predetermined structural framework that generates meaning

levels.name: Plot (Event Sequence)
levels.description: The unfolding of events constrained by idea and structure

levels.name: Panel Composition
levels.description: Individual visual moments within the structural framework

levels.name: Intertextual Layer
levels.description: References and allusions creating semantic density

core_algorithms.name: AM-GRID-01: Nine-Panel Rhythm Control
core_algorithms.purpose: Establish rhythmic baseline through rigid grid structure; make deviations meaningful through consistency
core_algorithms.pseudocode:
FUNCTION GridRhythm(narrative_beat):
  BASE_GRID = 9
  IF beat.tension == HIGH: RETURN standard_grid(9)
  IF beat.emphasis == CRITICAL: RETURN merge_panels(position, count)
  IF beat.type == SCENE_TRANSITION: RETURN page_break()
  IF beat.type == STRIP_END: RETURN row_break()
  impact = (deviation_size / baseline_panel_size) * consistency_factor

core_algorithms.name: AM-SYM-01: Palindrome Structure Generator
core_algorithms.purpose: Create meaning through structural correspondence; establish center as moral/narrative fulcrum
core_algorithms.pseudocode:
FUNCTION PalindromeNarrative(total_pages):
  center = total_pages / 2
  FOR page IN range(1, center):
    mirror_page = total_pages - page + 1
    page.layout = MIRROR(mirror_page.layout)
    page.scenes = THEMATIC_INVERSE(mirror_page.scenes)
  center_spread.action = CLIMACTIC_VIOLENCE
  center_spread.layout = PERFECT_BILATERAL_SYMMETRY

core_algorithms.name: AM-INT-01: Intertextual Density Layering
core_algorithms.purpose: Create re-readability through multiple reference layers requiring different competences to decode
core_algorithms.pseudocode:
FUNCTION IntertextualLayer(scene, density_target):
  layers = []
  layers.append(SELECT_EPIGRAPH(theme_keywords))
  layers.append(EMBED_VISUAL_REFERENCE(canonical_images, cultural_domain))
  layers.append(MIRROR_STRUCTURE(source_text.architecture))
  layers.append(PARALLEL_THEME(source_text.central_idea))
  RETURN layer_stack WHERE len(layers) >= density_target

core_algorithms.name: AM-META-01: Parallel Narrative Commentary
core_algorithms.purpose: Embedded narratives provide analytical framework; story-within-story comments on main narrative
core_algorithms.pseudocode:
FUNCTION EmbeddedNarrative(main_story, embedded_story):
  main = StoryLevel(primary=True)
  embedded = StoryLevel(primary=False)
  FOR main_character IN main.characters:
    embedded.character = CREATE_PARALLEL(shared_traits=main_character.flaws, outcome=DARK_MIRROR(main_character.arc))
  FOR scene IN main.scenes:
    IF scene.thematic_weight > THRESHOLD: INTERCUT(embedded.corresponding_scene)
  CREATE_CHARACTER(role='reader of embedded text', location='marginal', function='model interpretation')

core_algorithms.name: AM-TIME-01: Simultaneity Structure
core_algorithms.purpose: Literalize eternalist philosophy through comics' unique property of visible simultaneous page
core_algorithms.pseudocode:
FUNCTION BlockUniverseNarrative(character_with_temporal_perception):
  timeline = FLATTEN(past, present, future)
  FOR panel IN sequence:
    panel.tense = ETERNAL_PRESENT
    panel.captions = SIMULTANEOUS_VOICE('I am doing X' + 'I will do Y' + 'I have done Z')
  page_layout = SPATIAL_not_TEMPORAL
  narrative_affect = TRAGIC_DETERMINISM

diagnostic_questions.question: Does the story have a clear IDEA (thematic core) that precedes and constrains the plot?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: The central theme can be stated independently of plot events

diagnostic_questions.question: Does the grid/panel structure establish a consistent baseline that makes deviations meaningful?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Rhythmic regularity is maintained such that variation creates emphasis

diagnostic_questions.question: Are transitions invisible - does the reader lose awareness of reading?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Structural mechanics do not call attention to themselves

diagnostic_questions.question: Does structural symmetry create thematic correspondence?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Mirrored positions contain related/inverted content (beginning/consequence, intact/broken)

diagnostic_questions.question: Are multiple intertextual layers present for different reader competences?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: At least two layers: surface reference (quotation) and deeper structural/thematic echo

diagnostic_questions.question: Do embedded narratives comment on the main narrative?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Story-within-story parallels main character arcs or thematic concerns

diagnostic_questions.question: Is genre mastery demonstrated before deconstruction attempted?
Does the work include deliberate discomfort - genre/technique/style variation?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Evidence of forced-variation mechanisms preventing formulaic output

maps_to: Groensteen's System of Comics (rhythmic reading, beats, sighs, pauses)
Eternalism/Block Universe Theory (Dr. Manhattan's temporal perception)
Two-stage closure model (artist closes on script, reader closes on comic)

core_operations: Use deviation from grid for emphasis (larger panel = slower tempo = emphasis)
Create palindrome/symmetry structures with center as pivot
Layer intertextual references at multiple competence levels
Embed parallel narratives that comment on main story
Overdetermine scripts (more information than can be shown)
key_constraints: Density must serve story not demonstrate cleverness
